posts.text: Brain Rot was satire until it sounded like a medical report on my attention span.
drafts: Brain Rot was satire until it sounded like a medical report on my attention span.
Older song, current mood: Brain Rot.
I wrote this as a joke and accidentally told the truth.

posts.text: Too many tabs. One nervous system. #BrainRot
drafts: Too many tabs. One nervous system. #BrainRot
Time is fake, notifications are real.
Brain Rot in 20 seconds.

posts.text: Some songs are clocks. Brain Rot is an alarm.
drafts: Some songs are clocks. Brain Rot is an alarm.
You can laugh and panic in the same chorus.
Older song. New weather.

posts.text: Throwback transmission: from Brain Rot to Analog Myth, same signal different static.

Old songs age into new confessions.
This one still hits too close.

Subscribe on YouTube — help us hit 1,000.
Short transmission from the archive.
I keep receipts for feelings.
Tiny difference. Entire life rerouted.
I trust tape hiss more than perfect silence.

posts.text: If you can’t read clocks, maybe time is just a myth.
drafts: If you can’t read clocks, maybe time is just a myth.
Clocks measure numbers, not grief.
New transmission, same old ache.

posts.text: Late again. Right on emotional schedule.
drafts: Late again. Right on emotional schedule.
Brain Rot but make it folk punk.
One more transmission before midnight.
